# Chord: add4 in F# (Shape: G)

## Description:
The add4 chord in F# (played with the shape of G) consists of the notes F# (root), A# (major 3rd), C# (perfect 5th), and B (major 4th). The major 4th interval (B) creates a tension and color to the chord but doesn't change the overall quality of the major triad.

## Notes and Intervals:
- F# (root)
- A# (major 3rd)
- C# (perfect 5th)
- B (major 4th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The add4 chord in F# (Shape: G) is often used in genres like pop, rock, and jazz. It adds a sense of tension and ambiguity to the harmony, creating a refreshing and colorful sound that can be both emotive and intriguing. When used in progressions, it can add a modern and contemporary flair to the music.
